thread.title: Mercury to pass 40 on hot, humid Sunday in sweaty Sydney
thread.title_full: Mercury to pass 40 on hot, humid Sunday in sweaty Sydney

author: Riley Stuart
title: Mercury to pass 40 on hot, humid Sunday in sweaty Sydney

organizations.name: bondi surf bathers life saving club

text:
Map: Sydney 2000 
Sydney's sweaty summer is expected to continue on Sunday with the mercury tipped to pass 40 degrees Celsius in parts of the city. 
A top of 42C was predicted in Penrith, while people in Campbelltown, in the south, and Parramatta, in the west, are bracing for 40C. 
Temperatures were also soaring in regional New South Wales, with Bourke and Wilcannia, in the state's west, expected to reach 44C and 45C respectively. 
As Sydneysiders attempt to cool down, Bondi Surf Bathers Life Saving Club predicted 30,000 people could hit the sand at the city's most iconic beach over the course of the day. 
A top of 38C was expected on the coast. 
"When we get these hot days like this on weekends we can get up to 30,000 but luckily the surf conditions aren't rough today," one of the club's life savers, Louise Santos, said. 
"We need cooperation with people making sure that they're not a strong swimmer to swim between the flags. 
"Also it's important in this weather to slip, slop, slap and stay hydrated." 
NSW has endured a record-breaking summer. 
Moree, near the Queensland border, is on a sweltering streak where the mercury has topped 35C for the past 40 days. It is expected to reach 42C today.
